column3: Checklist item
Describe the study as forecast or prediction research in at least the title or abstract
Define the purpose of study and forecasting targets
Fully document the methods
Identify whether the forecast was performed prospectively, in real-time, and/or retrospectively
Explicitly describe the origin of input source data, with references
Provide source data with publication, or document reasons as to why this was not possible
Describe input data processing procedures in detail
State and describe the model type, and document model assumptions, including references
Make the model code available, or document the reasons why this was not possible
Describe the model validation, and justify the approach.
Describe the forecast accuracy evaluation method used, with justification
Where possible, compare model results to a benchmark or other comparator model, with justification of comparator choice
Describe the forecast horizon, with justification of its length
Present and explain uncertainty of forecasting results
Briefly summarize the results in non-technical terms, including a non-technical interpretation of forecast uncertainty
If results are published as a data object, encourage a time-stamped version number
Describe the weaknesses  of the forecast, including weaknesses specific to data quality and methods
If the research is applicable to a specific epidemic, comment on its potential implications and impact for public health action and decision making
If the research is applicable to a specific epidemic, comment on how generalizable it may be across populations
